name: Bengaluru fort heritage walk
description: Discover the history of the Bengaluru fort on this walk. The Fort though today reduced to a mere fraction of its original expanse—less than 5%—remains one of the most significant remnants of the city’s pre-colonial past. This heritage walk invites you to step into the vestiges of a fort that once bore witness to battles transitions of power architectural ingenuity and political resilience.The fort began as a modest mud structure before being fortified with stone during Hyder Ali’s rule and later expanded under his son Tipu Sultan. These walls though weathered by time preserve within them the layered narratives of a growing urban center and the complexities of South Indian resistance to British expansion.A highlight of the walk is the iconic Tipu Sultan’s Summer Palace a rare example of Indo-Islamic architecture with its intricate wooden pillars frescoes and elegant symmetry. Once the seat of royal administration and leisure the palace offers insights not only into architectural aesthetics but also into the socio-political life of the Sultanate in the 18th century.As we navigate the narrow lanes of Old Bengaluru one encounters a little-known but historically important site: a surviving armoury tucked into the urban sprawl and forgotten by modern maps. Used during Tipu’s reign this structure is a physical testament to the city’s martial past and the strategic importance of Bangalore in Mysore’s military planning.A focal point of this walk is the Battle of Bangalore (1791) a critical campaign during the Third Anglo-Mysore War. The battle pitted the British East India Company against Tipu Sultan’s forces and highlighted not only the military prowess of the Sultanate but also broader geopolitical shifts—especially the fallout of British actions in other global theatres such as in the American Revolutionary War.It is particularly notable that the Mysorean rockets used innovatively during this time caught the attention of British military observers. Some of these designs later found their way into documentation that would influence the development of European—and even American—military technology. Legend holds that they partly inspired Francis Scott Key’s reference to "the rockets' red glare" in the Star-Spangled Banner.Finally the walk concludes with a return to the present—by way of South Indian culinary tradition offering participants a curated local snack and a cup of filter coffee. A reminder that history does not only reside in books or ruins—it lives on in tastes traditions and memories.This walking tour is not just about stones and structures. It is a curated window into Bengaluru’s transformation—from fortified stronghold and seat of regional power to colonial outpost and finally to modern metropolis. In walking its paths we do not merely observe history; we retrace it.Note : "This walk is led by a Bengaluru native and professional architect who has lived and studied in the vicinity of the fort for over three decades. His deep-rooted connection to the area combined with his architectural expertise gives him an intimate knowledge of not just every corner of the fort but also the rich history that surrounds it."

name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

name: Brigade road heritage walk.
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Coffee and Conversations
description: What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

name: Qu for Quiz
description: The Qu for Quiz is based on a grid format with the grids formed by topics on one axis and level of difficulty (and hence the points) on the other. The topics could be varied like History, Sports, Music, Literature, Movies and more. A team of two members would get to choose a topic and the level of difficulty and the question would be revealed. The rest of the teams can go for the buzzer if they know the answer. Depending on the number of teams registering, the size of the grid would be decided.Ganesh Balakrishnan is an entrepreneur, marketer and creator of terrible dad jokes. His claim to fame is attempting to sell shoes during the pandemic, culminating in a viral Shark Tank "Down But Not Out" appearance. He is a collector of useless facts since childhood, and has dabbled in trivia quiz circuits since college. ganesh.flatheads@gmail.comKarthik Srinivasan is a pseudo-retired software leader by choice, specializing in innovative ideas to spend time that include organizing cricket leagues at the scale of IPL but for free, staying up to date on latest debates in virtual social groups helmed by family and friends and more on similar lines. emailkarth@gmail.com

name: Atta Galatta presents “Support Group”
description: Support Group by Nimesh George and Gokul R. People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every walk of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore. This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

No Restrictions, no judgements, just an intimate group of people looking for a space to be real. A space where we`re all less alone for a little while. Where we are seen, how we want to be seen. Conversations, Connections, Community of Compassion. All that makes the world go round, after Love of course!Remember - Sawubona: We See You.

name: Poetry Open Mic
description: Event Name: Mohlat: Zamaane ke fasaane seTheme: Poetry, Storytelling & Unfiltered ConversationsIn a city that runs on deadlines, traffic, and endless scrolling, when was the last time you truly paused?Mohlat (meaning 'respite' or 'grace period') is not just an event; it is a sanctuary carved out of time. We invite you to "Zamaane ke fasaane se"—an intimate evening dedicated to the art of slowing down.This is a space where the noise of the world fades away, replaced by the rhythm of poetry and the warmth of stories. Whether you are a Shayar with a diary full of couplets, a storyteller with a memory to share, or a listener looking for sukoon (peace), you belong here.WHAT TO EXPECT ✨ The Mehfil Vibe: Forget cold auditoriums. Imagine warm lights, floor seating (cushions and rugs), and a circle of strangers who feel like old friends.🎙️ The Open Mic: The stage is open to everyone. Hindi, Urdu, English, or Hinglish—language is no barrier when the emotion is real. Share your Nazms, Ghazals, or free-verse stories.☕ Chai & Guftagu: What is a poetry session without tea? Enjoy light refreshments and engage in meaningful conversations during our breaks.WHO IS THIS FOR?The Writer who has been hiding their poetry in the Notes app.The Listener who finds comfort in the words of others.The Soul looking to disconnect from screens and reconnect with people.NOTE: This is a zero-judgment zone. You don't need to be a professional performer. You just need to be authentic.

name: INDISHMAN: Book reading by Dr Gopi Chandroth
description: Dr Gopi Chandroth, author of INDISHMAN – Reflections from India, Britain and the Sea, will be at Atta Galatta Bookstore in Indiranagar on 1 February, from 4.30 pm to 6 pm. He will talk about selected stories and engage informally with the audience. Signed copies of the book will be on sale.The following are sample extracts from reviews on Amazon globally and on Goodreads:• India: “INDISHMAN reminded me of the lyrical beauty of Arundhati Roy, the vivid storytelling of Salman Rushdie, and the magic of García Márquez.”• UK: “A lovely meander through the vagaries of human nature. Each story warms the heart like a good malt whisky. A very well-written book; I defy anyone not to enjoy it.”• USA: “It (INDISHMAN) is hard to slot into a specific genre – the stories, reflections and gentle musings flit from rural Kerala to Nepal, from Southampton to the high seas with ease. They strike the perfect balance between being sharply observed and deeply memorable, yet light enough for an effortlessly enjoyable read, and never without a touch of humour and heart. Without a doubt, this has been the best six dollars and change I’ve spent in a very long time.”

name: SHAAM-E-BAAZGASHT | Bengaluru Diaries
description: Shaam-e-Baazgasht is an intimate, cosy, and immersive poetry experience drawn from Baazgasht – Echoes of Words & Silence, a bilingual Hindi–English collection that journeys through unrequited love, longing, heartbreak, queerness, healing, and the quiet courage of letting go.More than a performance, it is a gathering that invites presence.Through selected poems from the Baazgasht series, the evening unfolds alongside the stories that birthed them — gentle, honest conversations with the poet on his own journey, interwoven with brief guided moments of breathing, mindfulness, and emotional reflection. Together, these elements create a space where words are not merely heard, but felt — allowing the audience to touch closure, clarity, and a softer, steadier kind of inner peace.Shaam-e-Baazgasht | Bengaluru Diaries offers an evening of listening, pausing, and returning — to oneself.

name: Dinner with strangers by StepOut (Bengaluru)
description: Serendipity on a TableStepOut Dinners bring strangers together at some of the city’s best restaurants for an evening that feels easy, warm, and unexpectedly meaningful.You are seated at a small, thoughtfully curated table with people you would likely never meet otherwise. Different backgrounds, different stories, one shared meal. The crowd is balanced, open minded, and there by choice, not chance. No loud networking. No awkward icebreakers. Just good food, unforced conversations, and the kind of listening that rarely happens in daily life.The restaurants are carefully chosen. Comfortable, well loved spaces where you can settle in and talk without rushing. The focus is not on the menu alone, but on the atmosphere that allows connection to unfold naturally.Some nights are light and playful. Some go deeper than expected. Some surprise you quietly. That is the point.StepOut Dinners are not about dating or outcomes. They are about discovery. Showing up. Sitting down. Letting the table do its quiet work.Sometimes, all it takes is one seat at the right table for life to feel a little more open. For more information, visit www.stepout.world

Comfortable, well loved spaces where you can settle in and talk without rushing. The focus is not on the menu alone, but on the atmosphere that allows connection to unfold naturally.Some nights are light and playful. Some go deeper than expected. Some surprise you quietly. That is the point.StepOut Dinners are not about dating or outcomes. They are about discovery. Showing up. Sitting down. Letting the table do its quiet work.Sometimes, all it takes is one seat at the right table for life to feel a little more open. For more information, visit www.stepout.world

name: Bridgerton Singles Soirée Waitlist
description: Dearest Gentle Reader…In the year just past, we conducted a most curious experiment.We wondered what if courtship slowed down again? What if conversation came before chemistry? What if everyone… truly spoke to one another?So we brought back dance cards. Social seasons. And rooms where eye contact mattered more than algorithms.There was wit before want. Words before touch. A delicious tension, the kind they no longer teach us.And who would have thought… Old school still holds its magic.On the thirty-first of January, The Singles Soirée returns. Redesigned, refined, and far more daring.The same rules of civility. With greater stakes of desire.Yours truly awaits.Lady Big Nose.Intentionally curated based on how your first impressions, mind, and heart align. Or don’t — when you meet someone in real time.The format is conversation-led, everyone meets every other soul in the room through interactions, with a balanced gender ratio throughout the evening!Age range: mid 20s to mid 30s

name: JAZZ INDIA CIRCUIT 2026
description: Jazz India Circuit returns to Bengaluru for a night of contemporary jazz, deep grooves, and world-class live music — bringing together global excellence and homegrown talent on one stage. Part of the ninth edition of India’s leading jazz festival, the Bengaluru leg is designed for a city that truly listens. Headlining the evening is the Benny Greb Brass Band, delivering new-age jazz and funk powered by infectious rhythm and bold musical interplay. Known for their high-energy performances, the band brings a sound that is immersive, dynamic, and impossible to ignore.Joining them are Derek & the Cats, one of Bengaluru’s much-loved local acts, adding a familiar, groove-driven flavour that resonates deeply with the city’s live-music community.This is not background music or polite applause jazz. It’s an evening built for music lovers — whether you’re discovering jazz for the first time or already deep into the scene.Join us as Jazz India Circuit sets the groove in motion in Bengaluru for one unforgettable night.

name: The 14th Table: A Blind Date Supper
description: This Valentine’s Day, step away from swiping and into something real.We’re hosting a thoughtfully curated Blind Date Supper for 30 people (15 women & 15 men, open to queer folks) who don’t know each other, brought together around one beautiful long table for an evening of good food, guided conversations, and genuine human connection.This is not speed dating.This is not awkward networking.This is a hosted social experience designed for comfort, curiosity, and meaningful interaction.Throughout the evening, you’ll be gently guided through fun and connection-focused activities and games that help break the ice, spark conversations, and allow each person to connect one-on-one in a structured and respectful way. Whether you arrive hoping to meet a potential partner, make new friends, or simply enjoy a beautiful dinner with interesting new people, you are welcome here.Your ticket includes:✨ A curated blind date supper experience✨ Hosted connection games & bonding activities✨ Starters + main course + drink✨ Welcome entry experience✨ Thoughtful ice-breakers and table interactions✨ Gift cards & surprise giveaways✨ A warm, safe, aesthetically styled Valentine decor and ambienceAll pairings and interactions are structured to ensure everyone gets a fair opportunity to connect individually, without pressure or awkwardness.Come open-minded.Come well-dressed.Come ready to talk, laugh, and experience something new.Leave with a full stomach, new stories, and maybe — a new connection.

name: Sounds Like Love by The Counterpoint Crew
description: The Counterpoint Crew presents Sounds like LoveThis Valentine’s Day, step into a screen-free musical experience for an hour at Underline Centre, Indiranagar where 20 voices bring an unplugged concert with nothing but human voices.Across Kannada, Tamil, Hindi, Malayalam, Telugu, and English, familiar tunes are presented as an unique listening experience, where you sit back, take it in and let the sound move you. Designed as an intimate Valentine’s evening, it works whether you come solo, with a date, or with friends—no participation pressure.Format: Seated, immersive a cappella concert.Timing:First Show:- Doors open: 2:45 PM- Show: 3:00 PM – 4:00 PMSecond Show: SOLD OUT!Code of Conduct:• No smoking.• No alcohol on the premises.• Please keep phones on silentFood:• A food stall will be open before and after the show for purchases.• The stall will remain closed during the performance to keep the room quiet and focused.About the CrewThe Counterpoint Crew is an 20-member vocal ensemble based in Bangalore that blends classical techniques with contemporary repertoire. Born from a love of rich harmonies and collaborative arrangement, the Crew presents vocal textures that move fluidly between contemporary melodies, film music and western choral numbers. The crew contributed a brief background score to the acclaimed Kantara: Chapter 1. They have also collaborated with independent songwriters and composers along the way. The crew is committed to bringing choral music to a wider audience by performing relatable numbers in their set list.

name: Channapatna Toy Making Experience
description: 10:00 – 10:15 | Arrival & Craft OriginsStep into the world of Channapatna as artisans introduce the story behind India’s iconic GI-tagged wooden toys, their sustainable materials, and generations of craftsmanship.10:15 – 10:45 | Craft in MotionWatch raw wood transform on traditional lathes as artisans demonstrate wood turning, lacquer application, and vibrant colouring using natural dyes — a fast-paced, sensory introduction to living craft.10:45 – 12:00 | Create Your Own ToyGet hands-on as you paint and finish a pre-turned wooden toy, guided by master artisans. name: Sheethala - The Winter Kitchens of Karnataka
description: This winter, come spend an unhurried afternoon on a working farm right inside the city.At a time when the land is resting and winter produce is at its best, this gathering brings together food, art, and the farm itself. Just a short ride from the metro, the space feels like a pause from the city, where you can slow down, breathe a little, and spend time outdoors.The experience begins with a guided walk through the farm, where you will see what is growing during winter and learn about seasonal vegetables from Karnataka. We will talk about what grows in this season, why it grows, and how different regions traditionally cook with these ingredients.After the walk, you will sit down between the fields for a relaxed conversation about winter produce, followed by a watercolour painting session by Sangeetha Alwar from Mysore. Surrounded by pumpkins, greens, and roots, you will paint winter vegetables as still life. No prior art experience needed. This is about observing, experimenting, and enjoying the process.In the afternoon, a seated five course meal will be served on the farm by Ole Project. Each course highlights winter vegetables in comforting and creative ways, with small stories from Kannadiga kitchens shared along the way.Before you head back, you will get to harvest fresh greens from the farm yourself and take them home. This is not a rushed event. It is meant to be slow, grounding, and joyful.

name: Tarot For Yourself with Maria
description: Tarot for YourselfA lighthearted introduction to everyday intuitive readingTarot is not about prediction or being “gifted”.It is a language of symbols, stories, and intuition - something we all have access to.This 2-hour experiential workshop is an invitation to explore tarot as a tool for self-reflection and everyday guidance, especially if you’re curious, new, or have been learning through books and YouTube but want a more embodied understanding.Rather than memorising card meanings, we’ll focus on:•⁠  ⁠How tarot actually works as a mirror for your inner world•⁠  ⁠Learning to trust your intuitive responses to the images and symbols•⁠  ⁠Understanding the structure of the tarot (without going card-by-card)•⁠  ⁠How to ask grounded, empowering questions for yourself•⁠  ⁠Simple ways to read tarot for daily life, clarity, and decision-makingWe’ll also touch upon:•⁠  ⁠The difference between tarot and oracle cards•⁠  ⁠How to choose a deck that feels aligned with you•⁠  ⁠How to begin (or return to) tarot without feeling overwhelmedThe session will include interactive exercises, intuitive games, shared reflections, and an open Q&A - creating a relaxed, supportive space to explore and learn.This workshop is ideal for:•⁠  ⁠Beginners and curious explorers•⁠  ⁠People who already pull cards but doubt their interpretations•⁠  ⁠Anyone wanting to build a personal, intuitive relationship with tarotCome as you are. Curiosity is enough.

name: "I Like to Move It, Move It!" with Shena Gamat
description: In BANGALORE!I LIKE TO MOVE IT, MOVE IT! - Dancing for Non Dancers A movement playshop / discovery lab, with Shena GamatThis is not a ‘class’ in the sense of a teacher and students. Rather, it’s an open lab in which Shena will help you find new ways to think of movement and your body. Little tricks and tips, as well as some broad, universal principles - all in an effort to discover the joy of moving in new and creative ways.Some may call it “dance” some may call it “what in the world are you doing?” - but everyone will agree that it’s fun!All you need is loose, comfy clothing and an open mind. Age and so-called ‘ability’ absolutely no bar.Curiosity and JoyNo expectations, no ‘right’ and ‘wrong’Only discovery…***ABOUT SHENATheatre, Movement & Voice Artist + Training ConsultantThese days, Shena mostly potters around her little flat in Delhi, enjoying the parks and sunshine of the lovely winter months. Other than that, she is also a Master Facilitator with Syngrity Transformation Solutions, a voice over artist, actress, theatre director and founder of It’s All Good.***ABOUT ORANGE ARC COMMUNITY STUDIONestled in the quiet of Cooke Town in Bangalore, Orange Arc Community Studio is a home-like, traditional grounded space, curated to nurture opportunities for individuals to live their stories in its most authentic form. We encourage bringing alive experiential journeys that reflect our deep connection with the heart, inspiring creative awareness, joys of loving peace, harmony, alignment, and holistic well-being.We offer this safe space to empower experiences through- Meditation, Mindfulness, Movement, Yoga- Community Circles - Listening, Support, Meet-Ups, Learning Circles- Workshops/ Courses focused on Well-Being, Mental Health, Learning & Development- Dance, music, theatre, art, cultural events- Counseling, Healing & TherapyInsta: https://www.instagram.com/orangearc.community/***ABOUT IT’S ALL GOOD | The Science and Art of JoyIAG is an initiative aimed at returning to joy in a complex world. name: Sita’s Yoga: The Yoga of Awakening: Book Reading
description: Join us at Atta Galatta for a book reading with Dena Merriam, author of Sita’s Yoga: The Yoga of Awakening, a reflective and spiritually resonant work that reimagines Sita as a guide for inner transformation.In this book, Dena Merriam explores Sita not only as an avatar of the divine Narayani, but as a compassionate presence in the lives of ordinary people—those navigating family, work, duty, and the search for meaning. Through these encounters, the narrative turns inward, examining the everyday battles we face with anger, greed, fear, arrogance, and indifference. Ravana emerges as a powerful symbol of the forces that pull human consciousness toward materialism and delusion, both in Sita’s time and our own.Written with clarity and depth, Sita’s Yoga: The Yoga of Awakening invites readers to look within, to recognise and transform the shadows of the mind and heart, and to discover how inner awakening becomes the foundation for confronting the challenges of the outer world.Date: Sunday, 1 FebruaryTime: 5:00 PM – 7:00 PMVenue: Atta Galatta, Bengaluru

name: Within the Mind Lantern: Book Signing
description: Within the Mind Lantern, is a beautifully collection of 41 poems, that has been very well received by the early readers. It is thoughtfully divided into four soul-stirring sections that reads like a gentle walk through memories, emotions, and quiet self-realization. With this poetry collection, the author lights small lanterns within the reader’s mind, guiding them inward. The first section, poems on Nostalgia and Memories, feels like revisiting old photographs, bittersweet, familiar, and deeply comforting. They remind us how memories shape who we are, even when they hurt a little. In the section - Love, Family and Relations, the author captures the beauty of connection, the fragility of bonds, and the unspoken love that often lives between silences. The section on Nature, with gentle metaphors, the poems flow effortlessly, grounding the reader while offering moments of calm and reflection. The final section, Personal Growth and Inspiration, feels like a soft hand on your shoulder, encouraging, reassuring, and deeply empowering. They remind us that growth is personal, nonlinear, and beautifully imperfect. Within the Mind Lantern is not meant to be rushed. It is meant to be felt, revisited, and held close on quiet days. A luminous collection that speaks to the heart, this book is a perfect read if you are looking forward to reconnecting with yourself!Readers are invited to meet the author and get their copies signed at Atta Galatta.

name: Prakriti Pravaham
description: About the Event:Vidhushi Lalgudi Vijayalakshmi will be presenting a Carnatic violin concert with a theme inspired by the 5 elements of nature. She will be accompanied by Vidwan Tumkur Ravishankar on the mridangam and Vidwan Pramath Kiran on the Tabla and Morsing. The concert will take place on 21st Feb from 6-8pm at Courtyard Koota, Kengeri and tickets can be purchased at courtyardkoota.comAbout the ArtistsLalgudi VijayalakshmiA fifth-generation musician of the illustrious Lalgudi bani, Lalgudi Vijayalakshmi, daughter and disciple of legendary musician, Lalgudi G Jayaraman, is an artiste who engages both deeply and variedly with her music. As a violinist, she performs solo, duet, as an accompanist and collaborates with artistes across genres. She is also an accomplished vocalist, a composer, and a teacher. As a composer, besides musical compositions such as thillanas, varnams and krithis, she has also composed both lyrics and music for full length dance dramas, and set to tune works of great poets. With a sparkling four-decade-long journey in music, Vijayalakshmi has been recognized for her music through a slew of awards and accolades, including the most prestigious Sangita Kalanidhi by The Music Academy. A compliment she holds as particularly special is one that Pandit Ravi Shankar ji, the legendary sitar maestro showered on her, following her performance in the United States a few years ago - “You have your father’s fingers. Your music has touched my soul”. In her trust Krutagnya (Sanskrit for gratitude), Vijayalakshmi has been working to create awareness about the varied aspects of music and provide a stage for budding violinists from different schools to showcase their talent.S G Pramath KiranS G Pramath Kiran, a distinguished percussionist, music producer, and sound engineer, is a leading musician in India. Having embarked on his musical journey at the age of 3, he possesses expertise in both Carnatic and Hindustani music. Renowned for collaborations with top musicians worldwide, he founded Laya Digi Studios, producing numerous records. Notably, he's a featured artist in a Grammy award-winning album Devine Tides by Ricky Kej, showcasing his exceptional musical prowess.Tumkur B. RavishankarTumkur B. Ravishankar is a senior Mridangam artist and a Top Grade Artist of All India Radio and Doordarshan. He hails from a family of traditional Mridangam musicians. He began his training under his father, Sri Tumkur T. V. Bhadrachar, and later received advanced training from the renowned maestro Guru Sri Karaikudi R. Mani.Known for his clarity and control across both slow and fast tempos, Ravishankar has accompanied many leading Carnatic musicians. He has performed extensively in India and abroad and has received several titles and awards. He is currently associated with Akashvani, Mysuru, as a Top Grade Mridangam Artist.Tickets are mandatory for all.*

name: Pint of View (Lecture 34): Ten Million Fireflies
description: Ten Million Fireflies: What the night reveals when we learn to look: finding wonder, purpose, and policy in the darkMost of us here know this feeling. That sudden urge to leave the city behind. To drive out late at night, or take a trip to a remote village or up into the hills. Just to look up and catch a glimpse of a meteor shower. To see the galaxy with our own eyes. To sit in the dark long enough for stars to appear. And sometimes, if we’re lucky, to spot fireflies flickering in the distance.But then we return. To brighter streets, whiter lights, glowing windows. And slowly, without quite noticing, the night becomes something flatter. Emptier. Easier to ignore.A few years ago, while searching for stars near his home in India, Sriram noticed the same disappearance we often do. The stars were harder to find. But something else caught his attention instead. Large populations of fireflies, glowing steadily in the dark.The night, it turns out, is Sriram’s natural habitat. Under skies full of stars and forests alive with fireflies, he found not just wonder, but purpose. An engineer by training, working at Google, he made an unlikely choice. He left the job and move towards the night.What makes someone do that? How can looking up at the sky, or down at a firefly, redirect an entire life? And can stories, told well enough, change how we light our cities, protect our forests, and shape public policy?In this Pint of View lecture, Sriram will take us into the jungles after sunset. Into rare firefly behaviours, fragile nocturnal habitats, and the unseen costs of artificial light. He will share how astronomy, photography, and storytelling became tools for conservation, and how paying attention to the night can still change everything.About the Speaker:Sriram Murali has a deep passion for astronomy, fireflies, and the night. He tells stories that emotionally connect people to the wonders of the night and to the ill effects of losing it. His films on starry skies and light pollution have inspired many to look up, take action, influence policymakers, and champion dark-sky movements.Through his work on fireflies in the Western Ghats, Sriram has influenced state governments to address light pollution in India. He is a National Geographic Explorer and an IUCN SSC expert on fireflies and light pollution. Sriram and his team at Wild and Dark Earth (an NGO) collaborate with scientific institutions, government bodies, and the lighting industry to restore natural darkness for wildlife.Event detailsDate: Sunday, 1 February 2026Time: 6 PM – 8 PMVenue: 1st Floor, Atta Galatta, IndiranagarWhat your ticket includes1 complimentary sober beverage (soda, kombucha or gingerale from Local Ferment Co.)

name: Exuberant Life Retreat - Preview
description: Our mind and our body are deeply connected to each other. What the mind forgets the body stores as memory. Infact every single emotion we have ever felt is stored in our nervous system. The nervous system has only one main goal - to scan for safety and danger to keep us safe. What the body senses are a danger makes the nervous system develop a coping mechanism. While this protects us from the initial danger/threat, we forget the danger has passed  and continue to behave/react the same way long after the threat has eased. This is the reason we keep repeating behaviours and thoughts even though we know it isn't helping. At this workshop you will understand the cause and effect behind this. And you will experience a powerful healing modality through your own breath. To release stored trauma or suppressed emotions using your own breath.

name: Fair Play is the New Foreplay: A Playshop
description: Modern relationships don’t break down from lack of love, they get strained by invisible work. This Valentine’s Day, learn how to see it, share it, and build a partnership that feels fair.Using the globally acclaimed Fair Play system, couples will learn the language and tools to divide the mental load without resentment or score-keeping. Less romance clichés, more real teamwork. Expect good humour, guided prompts, private couple conversations, and a practical system you can actually use at home.Who this is forCouples who want a fairer division of household and emotional labourCouples who love each other but struggle to talk about chores, planning, or invisible workExpecting or new parents navigating shifting rolesLong-term couples wanting more clarity, less scorekeepingCouples curious about the Fair Play methodWho this is not forCouples seeking therapy or conflict interventionIndividuals attending without their partnerPeople expecting a lecture; this is participatoryWhat to bringYour partner (mandatory)Humility, curiosity, a sense of humourWillingness to be honestOpenness to trying a new systemEverything else is provided.You’ll leave with:A repeatable system for sharing responsibilitiesThe cards and handouts to use at homeA shared understanding of the mental loadA healthier way to talk about chores, planning, and expectationsIt’s playful, honest, and surprisingly romantic, because, let’s face it, fireworks fade and true teamwork lasts.About the Facilitator:Natasha Uppal is India’s first Matrescence Coach and Founder of Matrescence India. Natasha studies motherhood, mental load, and what actually makes healthy, long-term partnerships work. The playshop is based on Eve Rodsky’s bestselling Fair Play book and method, a globally recognised system used by couples to re-balance household labour and reclaim time, creativity, and sanity.Natasha’s approach is bold, evidence-informed, and deeply human. She believes navigating the mental load is a journey, not a judgment, and that conversations about shared labour are one of the most important and intimate forms of care. This playshop is a soft launch into that journey, and a powerful experience for couples who believe that romantic partnerships are sustained by more than candlelight dinners and Netflix and Chill. 🙂

description: Bread & Food Systems is the first workshop in the Bread & ____ series — a hands-on, conversation-led sourdough and bread education programme by Loafer & Co. and Edible Issues.In this session, participants will bake a 100% whole wheat / ancient wheat sourdough loaf, while exploring the complex stories behind the grains we use every day.As we mix, fold, and shape our dough, we’ll pause for conversations with the people who nurture these grains, understand their ecological and cultural histories, and reflect on the supply chains that shape our bread.This session brings together voices from farming, science, and artisan baking to help us see bread not just as food, but as a window into soil, labour, climate, and community.Speakers & FacilitatorsAnushka Neyol — Farmer & Grain Grower, Three-One FarmsPranav Ullal — Sourdough Baker, Loafer & Co.Facilitated by Edible Issues — Conversations on food systems, sourcing, climate, and cultureHands-On Exercise: You will work with: 100% whole wheat or ancient wheatUnderstanding hydration, gluten development, textureLearning how flour variety, soil, and climate impact the loafFolding, shaping, scoring, and retarding steps

name: Human Library Bengaluru
description: Each chapter of Human Library is a guided space for meaningful, non-judgmental conversations, structured by thoughtful prompts. These prompts allow attendees to explore different perspectives, stories, and memories.Note: This is not a dating event.You can choose to listen to others` stories and share your own when you feel comfortable. Every participant takes turns sharing a memory, opinion, or experience related to the prompt assigned to them.Structure of the event:1. Introduction of attendees and the host.2. Attendees are divided into smaller groups.3. Each group receives a bowl of prompts.4. Prompts are divided into three levels: Level 1, Level 2, and Level 3.5. Level 1 prompts help people get to know each other.Example: What is your earliest childhood memory?6. Level 2 prompts encourage deeper conversations.Example: What is one habit from your lifestyle that you would recommend to others?7. Once Level 1 and Level 2 conversations are completed, the smaller groups are merged for Level 3 prompts.8. Depending on the number of attendees, either one or two larger groups are formed for Level 3 conversations.Come. Join. Share your stories or listen to others.

name: THT presents RINI and Monday Puppets
description: About RINI:Leading an international cadre of musicians, New Jersey based, Chennai born singer, composer and violinist Harini "Rini" Raghavan creates her own version of Indian Jazztronica. Harini draws from her formal training in Carnatic music and work at Berklee College of Music in Electronic Production to bring together sounds and music of her birthplace in India and her home in the US. An experienced performer and recording artist, she has recorded and performed with Grammy winning composers A.R.Rahman, Bill Whelan and the renowned Israeli Singer-Songwriter Idan Raichel, headlining prestigious festivals and venues in the US including Boston Symphony Hall,Lincoln Center, Beacon Theatre and the United Nations General Assembly and in India including Phoenix Market City Bengaluru, Barracuda Brew Chennai, Under 25 Festival Bengaluru, Antisocial Mumbai, High Spirits Pune and Auro Delhi. Rini has released music worldwide to critical acclaim, including a feature in Rolling Stone India, New York Music Daily, Republic of Jazz and World Music Central.Monday Puppets:Formed in early 2025, Monday Puppets is a Bangalore-based band that thrives on improvisation and musical spontaneity. Emerging from the city’s dynamic and eclecticmusic scene, the band embraces a style that is fluid, spontaneous, and constantly evolving. Their sound is shaped by the art of improvisation—with each performanceshaped by spontaneous interactions and the energy of the present moment. The band features Legsang Sherpa on guitar, Solomon Bishwakarma on keyboard, Roshan Thapa on bass, and Rahul Diyali on drums. As a collective, they bring a spirit of exploration and creativity to their craft, blending a range of musical influences into a unified and boundaryless sonic experience.The Humming Tree:The Humming Tree - A grassroots performance venue in Bangalore, running from 2013 to 2019 and in the process becoming a cornerstone of Bangalore’s independent music, art, and cultural ecosystem.Now, in 2026, The Humming Tree is back in a brand-new, purpose-designed space in Indiranagar. Built across 12,000 sq. ft., the venue features a 600+ capacity performance space, world-class sound and lighting systems, and a diverse F&B proposition. More than just a venue, it’s a hub for creativity, culture and collaboration.

name: Steeped in Scandal: An intimate tea-time session
description: Known for her sweeping tales of mythology and history, Anuja is stepping away from the epic battles to indulge in some delicious, modern-day gossip with us. This isn’t your average literary talk—this is your chance to play investigator. We’re inviting you to submit your most "gossipy" questions for Anuja to answer live. Whether you're curious about the scandals behind her stories or want her to take on a provocative prompt, no topic is too bold and no secret is safe over a cup of chai.Come for the tea, stay for the revelations!Bio:Anuja Chandramouli is a bestselling author and new age Indian classicist widely regarded as one of the finest writers in mythology, historical fiction and fantasy. Her highly acclaimed debut novel, Arjuna: Saga of a Pandava Warrior-Prince, was named as one of the top 5 sellers in the Indian writing category for the year 2012 by Amazon India. Her book, Mohini: The Enchantress was the winner of the JK Papers and Times of India Popular Choice Author award for the year 2021. Her books are also available as audiobooks and have been translated into Hindi. Abhimanyu: Son of Arjuna has been shortlisted for the Atta Galatta – Bangalore Literature Festival Book Prize. GIRL TALK and THE WIFE AND THE DANCING GIRL are her latest books. An accomplished TEDx speaker and storyteller, Anuja Chandramouli, regularly conducts workshops on creative writing, mythology and empowerment in schools and colleges across the country. Her Mahabharata and Ramayana with Anuja storytelling series is now available on YouTube, Spotify, TuneIn Alexa, Apple Podcasts. She is a trained Bharatanatyam dancer and a columnist for The New Indian Express. This mother of two little girls lives in Sivakasi, Tamil Nadu.

name: Creaturely Circles: What if the Land were Alive?
description: ​Many of us grew up learning to think of land as a resource; a resource to be managed. This way of thinking about land was seen as neutral and practical. We were taught by well-intentioned geography teachers to studiously mark out on political maps of India, where we might find coal, bauxite and iron with little triangles, circles and squares.​But what does that framing leave out?​Across many cultures and times, land has not been understood as inert or separate, but as alive, animate. In these understandings, humans were active participants in the conditions that allowed life to thrive in the lands they lived on. Research and lived histories increasingly suggest, for example, that the supposedly pristine, untouched Amazonian Rainforest was in fact shaped by humans over thousands of years. It is the same story closer to home with Adivasis and nomadic pastoralists having profoundly shaped landscapes that we see as wild.​While such forms of intimacy with the land may feel distant for many of us with urban lives today, our disconnection from land, seeing it as object, seeing it as resource than living presence, is a very, very recent phenomenon in our long human story.​Without romanticizing realities we may never have known, this gathering invites us to explore connections we may have forgotten and longings that are waiting to be discovered.Because we have limited spots - please register only if you can really be there!

name: Tired & Wired
description: Do you feel tired in your body, but unable to truly slow down?Tired & Wired is a 90-minute, slow and supportive experience designed for those moments when rest feels distant and the nervous system feels overstimulated. This workshop offers a gentle pause - to settle, ground, and reconnect with yourself.Through soft yoga movement, calming breath awareness, and reflective journaling, we’ll create space for the body to unwind and the mind to soften. The session is slow-paced, choice-based, and beginner-friendly, with no pressure to perform or push.The intention is not to “fix” anything, but to listen, slow down, and leave feeling more settled and present.No prior yoga or journaling experience is required.You’re welcome exactly as you are.
